title: How to Make an Apple Sponge

steps.headline: Cut the apples into slices.
steps.description: If you like, you can peel them, but having the skins makes them more nutritious.

steps.headline: Combine the apple, sugar, and water in a medium saucepan.
Cook the apple filling on low heat for 10 minutes.
steps.description: When ready, the apple filling should be tender.

steps.headline: Beat up eggs in a small bowl with an electric mixer.
steps.description: In 7 minutes, it should be thick and creamy.

steps.headline: Spoon apple mixture into the ovenproof dish.
Bake in the oven for 25 minutes.
steps.description: The cake should be golden brown color.

text: Preheat oven to 180°C (400°F).  Grease a large ovenproof dish.  Cut the apples into slices. If you like, you can peel them, but having the skins makes them more nutritious. Combine the apple, sugar, and water in a medium saucepan.  Cook the apple filling on low heat for 10 minutes. When ready, the apple filling should be tender. Beat up eggs in a small bowl with an electric mixer. In 7 minutes, it should be thick and creamy. Gradually add sugar. Beat well after each addition. Fold in flours.  Spoon apple mixture into the ovenproof dish.  Pour sponge over apple mixture.  Bake in the oven for 25 minutes. The cake should be golden brown color. Finished.
